Optical Character Recognition¶

scinoephile.ocr.OCRBase Base for OCR classes
scinoephile.ocr.OCRCLToolBase Base for OCR command line tools
scinoephile.ocr.OCRDataset Represents a collection of character images
scinoephile.ocr.UnlabeledOCRDataset Represents a collection of unlabeled character images
scinoephile.ocr.LabeledOCRDataset Represents a collection of labeled character images
scinoephile.ocr.GeneratedOCRDataset Represents a collection of generated character images
scinoephile.ocr.ImageSubtitleDataset Represents a collection of image-based subtitles
scinoephile.ocr.ImageSubtitleSeries Represents an image-based subtitle track
scinoephile.ocr.ImageSubtitleEvent Represents an individual image-based subtitle

Base Classes¶

OCR Base¶

class scinoephile.ocr.OCRBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: scinoephile.Base

Base for OCR classes

chars¶

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: Characters

char_frequency_table¶

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: Character frequency table

chars_to_labels(chars)[source]¶

Converts collection of characters to character labels

Args:
chars (np.ndarray(U64), str): characters

Returns (np.ndarray(int64): labels of provided characters

labels_to_chars(labels)[source]¶

Converts collection of character labels to characters themselves

Args:
labels (np.ndarray(int64): labels

Returns (np.ndarray(U64): characters of provided labels

str: Image mode

str: Path to input file

str: Path to output file

imagespecs (pandas.DataFrame): New specs imagedata (numpy.ndarray): New imagedata

Args:
outfile (str, optional): Path to hdf5 file; defaults to
self.output_hdf5

Args:
outdir (str): Path to output directory; defaults to
self.output_image_dir

font_y_offsets¶

list(int): List of font y offsets

int: Number of unique characters to support

str: Image mode

save(path, format_=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Saves subtitles to an output file, warning that data will be lost if not saved to hdf5

pysubs2.SSAFile.save expects an open text file, so we open the hdf5 file here for consistency.

classmethod load(path, encoding='utf-8', image_mode=None, verbosity=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

SSAFile.from_file expects an open text file, so we open hdf5 here
